title: Did George H.W. Bush Say He Would Be ‘Lynched’ If Americans Knew the Truth?
subtitle: The forty-first President of the United States allegedly uttered the statement in response to a journalist's question about Iran-Contra in 1992, yet it has eluded documentation for a quarter-century.
author: David Emery
vclaim: George H.W. Bush once said: "If the people were to ever find out what we have done, we would be chased down the streets and lynched."
